Package entities

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
entities.Entity
entities.Enemy
Direct Known Subclasses:
Skeleton
public abstract class Enemy extends Entity
This is an abstract class that provides the framework for all Enemy objects in the game. Individual types of enemies should extend this class, but this should never be a specific enemy. This will help all Enemies have the same behavior and make it easier to create/implement the EnemyManager.
Author:
Sean-Paul Brown

  • Field Details

    • attacking

      protected boolean attacking
      Keeps track of if this Enemy is currently attacking the player

    • active

      protected boolean active

    • firstUpdate

      protected boolean firstUpdate
      The firstUpdate keeps track of if the enemy has been updated at all. On the first update, the enemy should check if it is in the air. After the first update, the Enemy should never re-enter the air.

    • enemy_type

      protected int enemy_type
      The type of Enemy it is, based on the EnemyConstants

    • tileY

      protected int tileY
      The vertical (y-axis) tile that the Enemy is on

    • attackChecked

      protected boolean attackChecked
      used to keep track of if a single attack has been checked for collision with the player

    • walkSpeed

      protected float walkSpeed
      the movement speed of the enemy

    • hitboxYOffset

      protected float hitboxYOffset
      The image offset from top side of image to top side of hitbox. The offset is 55 when game scale is 1.75, so divide to make it work for all scales

    • score

      protected int score

    • killed

      protected boolean killed

    • attackDistance

      protected float attackDistance
      the variables that keep track of how the player sees and attacks the palyer

    • eyeSight

      protected float eyeSight

    • walkDirection

      protected int walkDirection

  • Constructor Details

    • Enemy

      public Enemy(float x, float y, int width, int height, int enemy_type)
      Initializes an Enemy instance
      Parameters:
      x - - the x-coordinate of the Enemy, will be left side of hitbox
      y - - the y-coorindate of the Enemy, will be the top side of hitboc
      width - - the width of the hitbox
      height - - the height of the hitbox
      enemy_type - - the type of enemy, based of utils.Constants.EnemyConstants

  • Method Details

    • updateAniTick

      protected void updateAniTick()
      This will update what tick the enemy is on, and then will change the frame the enemy is on. If the end index has been reached it will restart.

    • startNewState

      protected void startNewState(int newState)
      This should be used to change the enemy state, instead of assigning it. This will reset the ticks/index
      Parameters:
      newState - - the state to be changed too

    • hurt

      public void hurt(int damageTaken)
      This function will subtract what ever damage is inputed into this method from the entity total health. If the enemy reaches 0 health, it will deactivate and die.
      Parameters:
      damageTaken - - the amount of damage taken by this entity

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Getter for the active boolean
      Returns:
      the current value of active

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g)
      This function will have no purpose. The EnemyManager will draw all Enemies since it is better for memory to have imgs stored there. USE ENEMY MANAGER DRAW INSTEAD
      Parameters:
      g - - the graphics where to draw the Enemy

    • checkHit

      public void checkHit(Player player)
      This will check if this enemy's attack box intersects with the players hitbox. If it does, the attack connected and player takes damage.
      Parameters:
      player - - the Player entity

    • turnTowardsPlayer

      protected void turnTowardsPlayer(Player player)
      Turn the sprite/walking direction
      Parameters:
      player - - the Player entity

    • canSeePlayer

      protected boolean canSeePlayer(int[][] lvlData, Player player)
      Check if the player is within eyesight and clear line of sight. Players must be on same tile to be seen.
      Parameters:
      lvlData - - the data from the level as a 2D int array
      player - - the main Player
      Returns:
      returns true if there is a clear line of sight to the player and within sight

    • isPlayerInSightRange

      private boolean isPlayerInSightRange(Player player)
      Check that the absolute value of the distance is within the eyeSight of the enemy.
      Parameters:
      player - - the Player in the game
      Returns:
      true if the player is within the enemy's eyesight

    • isInAttackRange

      protected boolean isInAttackRange(Player player)
      Check if the player is within attack range
      Parameters:
      player - - the Player entity
      Returns:
      true the player is, either side

    • updateInAir

      protected void updateInAir(int[][] lvlData)
      Update how the enemy will behave in the air/landing
      Parameters:
      lvlData - - the current Level's data as a 2D int array

    • firstUpdateCheck

      protected void firstUpdateCheck(int[][] lvlData)
      This is the first update, should only run once when it is the first update. Since enemies can't jump, it checks if they spawned in the air.

    • switchWalkDirection

      protected void switchWalkDirection()
      This method will switch the walk direction horizontally. If they enemy is moving right, then they will turn left. If left, then turn right

    • move

      protected void move(int[][] lvlData)
      This method determines how the Enemy will move and how fast they will.
      Parameters:
      lvlData - - the current Level's data as a 2D int array

    • xFlipped

      public int xFlipped()
      This function will return the X-position of the entity based on which direction it is facing. This will allow the Enemies to be drawn facing both directions.
      Returns:
      width of the Enemy if walking left, 0 if facing right;

    • widthFlipped

      public int widthFlipped()
      This method will return a scalar value to multiply the drawn width by, which depends on which direction the Enemy is facing. This allows the Enemy to be drawn correctly either direction.
      Returns:
      -1 if facing left, 1 if facing right

    • isKilled

      public boolean isKilled()
      Getter for the killed boolean
      Returns:
      the current value of killed
